nodes.bodyText: Was this what made the hexagons before? Are we not having the hexagons anymore?
Starting in line 92 in this class there is a TODO and a commented private method. Is this dead code? Do we need it, or can we remove it?

The item is neither a "hexagon" anymore nor do we need the class here anymore.
The dead code has been copied to #303
What does removing the "data-identifier" attribute do?
"data-identifier" is used in javascript to obtain the item identifier. This has been moved to a parent element (see below).
What does the data-identifier and the class attribute change here?
The element gets on onClick event (all ".item" elements) and the identifier is used to show correct item data in a dialogue.
Okay, I haven't looked into the frontend logic querying for these yet.
How are we still testing the SVGItemLabel now?
Okay, the problem I had was indeed resolved by obtaining the npm dependency. 👍
Why not making the parameter @Nonnull and using the DEFAULT_ICONS_FOLDER as the fallback value?
I've had to look up how that is done using injected values, but it works. Change is pushed.
What do we need this for?
nodes.diffHunk:

   baseUrl: ${NIVIO_BASE_URL:}
   version: #project.version#
   pollingMilliseconds: 30000 # 30 secs
+  # iconFolder: /a/local/path

nodes.bodyText: Ah, okay, to provide it, if it is different than the default folder 💡
